qas.question: What do Westerners believe it means to belong to the Greek heritage ?

answers.text: Western standards, the term Greeks has traditionally referred to any native speakers of the Greek language, whether Mycenaean, Byzantine or modern Greek.

qas.question: What do the Grecian Romioi  descendants of the Constantine rule  believe to be true in regards to the status as beneficiaries ?

answers.text: considered themselves the political heirs of Rome

qas.question: What other cultures do the Romioi  clam to be their birthright ?

answers.text: deemed themselves the heirs of ancient Greece as well

qas.question: What is an alternative word used by Greeks to mean those who worship and alternative religion to the mainstreams ?

plausible_answers.text: any native speakers of the Greek language

qas.question: What do Easterners believe it means to belong to the Greek heritage
What do the Grecian Romioi descendants of the Constantine rule believe to be false in regards to the status as beneficiaries
What other cultures do the Romioi clam to not be their birthright
What is an alternative word used by Greeks to mean those who don't worship and alternative religion to the mainstreams

context: The terms used to define Greekness have varied throughout history but were never limited or completely identified with membership to a Greek state. By <a0_0>Western standards, the term Greeks has traditionally referred to <b4_0>any native speakers of the Greek language<b4_0/>, whether Mycenaean, Byzantine or modern Greek.<a0_0/> Byzantine Greeks called themselves Romioi and <a1_0>considered themselves the <b5_0><b6_0>political heirs of Rome<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/>, but at least by the 12th century a growing number of those educated, <a2_0>deemed themselves the heirs of ancient Greece as well<a2_0/>, although for most of the Greek speakers, "<a3_0><b7_0>Hellene<b7_0/>" still meant pagan<a3_0/>. On the eve of the Fall of Constantinople the Last Emperor urged his soldiers to remember that they were the descendants of Greeks and Romans.
